4. Beta-blockers: These are a class of drugs that block the action of certain hormones, such as adrenaline, on the heart and blood vessels. Beta-blockers are a chemical entity.
5. Blood-pressure: This refers to the force exerted by the blood on the walls of the blood vessels. While blood pressure is not a chemical entity, it is closely related to the chemical properties of the blood and the functioning of the cardiovascular system.

Therefore, the only chemical entity in the paragraph is "beta-blockers".
